CONCLUSION: Violation of Art. 6-1;Violation of Art. 13;Non-pecuniary damage - financial award;Costs and expenses partial award - Convention proceedings
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born DATE and lives in PERSON .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was injured in a car accident . The perpetrator of the accident had taken out insurance with the insurance company A.

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant instituted civil proceedings against A in ORG ( Okrožno sodišče v PERSON ) seeking damages in the amount of CARDINAL NORP tolars ( MONEY ) for the injuries sustained . In the course of the proceedings the applicant increased her claim to CARDINAL NORP tolars .
DATE and DATE the applicant lodged CARDINAL preliminary written submissions and/or adduced evidence .
The court held a hearing on DATE and adjourned it in order to obtain medical expert opinions .
On DATE the court appointed the Commission for the Expert Opinions at ORG ( “ the Expert Commission ” ) to draw up relevant expert opinions .
On CARDINAL DATE and DATE the applicant made requests that some experts be excluded from the proceedings . She also addressed such requests directly to ORG .
DATE and DATE the court CARDINAL times summoned the experts to produce their reports .
On DATE the court received CARDINAL expert opinions from ORG together with the case - file . CARDINAL expert opinions remained to be filed .
On DATE the applicant urged the court to immediately decide on her requests concerning the exclusion of experts .

On DATE the court issued a decision rejecting the before mentioned requests finding that they had been lodged out of time . The decision was served on the applicant on DATE and she appealed on DATE . On DATE ORG ( PERSON v PERSON ) rejected her appeal .
The remaining CARDINAL expert opinions were submitted by DATE
On DATE a hearing was held . The new hearing was scheduled for DATE .
